title: How to Use Dropbox with Yahoo! Mail

steps.headline: Upload the file to Dropbox.
steps.description: You can either upload the file directly to your Dropbox online account or put the file on your local Dropbox folder for online syncing.

steps.headline: Compose a new email message.
steps.description: Any length to any amount of people. If you want to experiment with attaching files, just send one to yourself.

steps.headline: Attach a file from Dropbox.
steps.description: In the compose email window, click on the clip icon for the attachment Options. Choose Share from Dropbox. A dialog window should appear that contains your Dropbox folders. Navigate through your folders and locate the file you’d like to attach. You can attach multiple files at once by selecting them. The files will be highlighted or marked once selected. You can attach files of multiple formats as well. Songs, PDFs, movies, etc.

steps.headline: Complete your email message.
steps.description: The file you chose would be shared via a Dropbox link embedded inside your email message. It won’t necessarily be physically attached, but the file can be accessed directly from the link provided.

steps.headline: Send your email.
steps.description: You may wish to CC yourself to see the email and see how the link worked.

methods.name: Saving an Attached File to Dropbox

steps.headline: Open an email with an attachment.
steps.description: Any attachment size (within reason) should be fine.

steps.headline: Locate the attachment.
steps.description: The attachment is located towards the bottom of the email message. You should see a paperclip next to the name of the file.

steps.headline: Download the attachment.
steps.description: Click on the Download link beside the attached file. Choose Save to Dropbox. A dialog window should appear for you to specify the location where the file would be stored in your Dropbox folders. Choose the location and click Save.

steps.headline: View the attachment from Dropbox.
steps.description: You can either download the file from your Dropbox online account or from your local Dropbox folder after it has been synced.

Attach a file from Dropbox. In the compose email window, click on the clip icon for the attachment Options. Choose Share from Dropbox. A dialog window should appear that contains your Dropbox folders. Navigate through your folders and locate the file you’d like to attach. You can attach multiple files at once by selecting them. The files will be highlighted or marked once selected. You can attach files of multiple formats as well. Songs, PDFs, movies, etc. Click Choose.  Complete your email message. The file you chose would be shared via a Dropbox link embedded inside your email message. It won’t necessarily be physically attached, but the file can be accessed directly from the link provided. Send your email. You may wish to CC yourself to see the email and see how the link worked. Saving an Attached File to Dropbox Log in to your Yahoo! Mail account. Open an email with an attachment. Any attachment size (within reason) should be fine. Locate the attachment. The attachment is located towards the bottom of the email message. You should see a paperclip next to the name of the file. Download the attachment. Click on the Download link beside the attached file. Choose Save to Dropbox. A dialog window should appear for you to specify the location where the file would be stored in your Dropbox folders. Choose the location and click Save. View the attachment from Dropbox. You can either download the file from your Dropbox online account or from your local Dropbox folder after it has been synced.
